intro: Phlomoides rotala, commonly known as waterplantain, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, pond edges, and stream banks. Phlomoides rotala is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
